qas.question: What languages does Hamp say are similar to Armenian?
What subgroup does Hamp put the Armenian language in?
Where does Hamp say the Pontic Indo-European languages originate?

answers.text: the northeast coast of the Black Sea and its hinterlands

qas.question: What languages does Caucasus think are similar to Batumi?
Into what language subgroup is Batumi categorized?

plausible_answers.text: the northeast coast of the Black Sea and its hinterlands
westwards along the southern coast of the Black Sea

qas.question: Where is it thought the Batumi migrated?
In what year did Caucasus develop his Indo-Eurpoean family tree?

context: Eric P. Hamp in his <b7_0>2012<b7_0/> Indo-European family tree, groups the Armenian language along with <a0_0><b3_0>Greek and Ancient Macedonian<b3_0/><a0_0/> ("Helleno-Macedonian") in <b4_0>the <a1_0>Pontic Indo-European<b4_0/><a1_0/> (also called Helleno-Armenian) subgroup. In Hamp's view the homeland of this subgroup is <a2_0><b5_0>the northeast coast of the Black Sea and its hinterlands<b5_0/><a2_0/>. He assumes that they migrated from there southeast through the Caucasus with the Armenians remaining after Batumi while the pre-Greeks proceeded <b6_0>westwards along the southern coast of the Black Sea<b6_0/>.
